content:
My frontend skills are not very good... can this be done in a template file after all? It's a field template for an image gallery, works pretty well, but I would like to print a different image style in line 65 (and maybe also the images title field content on the same line). It it's a bigger issue, I am also ready to hire someone.

Screenshot-2020-03-13-at-16.36.30.png
If you have devel installed you should be able to use dpm($item); to see what data is available, and then use theme_image_style to adjust the image style that gets used.

@Laryn thank you so much for your help, although it's quite embarrassing for me to NOT having tried with DPM (i simply have forgotten this, I am getting old;-
)
There's also a built-in debug command which does the same but dpm formats it nicer. Remember to clear cache with each change

@mazze.ch I setup a similar template file to yours in my sandbox to play with this, and adding this line produced thumbnails that link to large images:
<a href="<?php print image_style_url('large', $item['#item']['uri']); ?>"><img src="<?php print image_style_url('thumbnail', $item['#item']['uri']); ?>" /></a>
This is a great help, thank you @BWPanda (Peter)
